recipes.title: Nana's Broccoli Salad
recipes.description: A beautiful and tasty broccoli salad with grapes, bacon, and a sweet mayonnaise dressing.

instructions.text: Mix broccoli, grapes, raisins, onions, almonds and bacon. (Can be mixed ahead of time).
Just before serving, mix mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar and pour "dressing" over salad mixture.
Stir well.
Makes a beautiful and very tasty salad.

notes: Salad ingredients can be mixed ahead; add dressing just before serving.
Original card has festive candy cane border - likely a holiday favorite.
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 33.jpeg

recipes.title: Rotini Salad Bowl
recipes.description: A classic pasta salad with ham or shrimp, peas, and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Cook Del Pino's rotini according to directions above. Drain, do not chill.
While still hot, drizzle with oil and vinegar. Add onion, seasonings, and cheese; toss well.
Gently mix in remaining ingredients. Chill thoroughly. Serve on salad greens.

notes: Del Pino's cooking instructions: Pour 2 cups of rotini in 2 quarts of rapidly boiling water. Add 2 teaspoons of salt if desired. Boil 8 to 10 minutes until tender.
Can use any spiral pasta.

recipes.title: Kashi Vegetable Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing cold salad with Kashi and fresh vegetables.

instructions.text: Combine cooled Kashi with all vegetables.
Whisk together olive oil and lemon juice.
Pour dressing over salad and toss.
Add parsley, salt, and pepper.
Chill at least 1 hour before serving.

notes: Similar to tabbouleh but with Kashi instead of bulgur

recipes.title: Festive Cranberry Pineapple Salad
recipes.description: A holiday gelatin salad with cranberry sauce, pineapple, apple, and walnuts.

instructions.text: DRAIN pineapple, reserving all of the liquid in a 1-quart liquid measuring cup. Remove 1 Tbsp. of the crushed pineapple; set aside for garnish.
Add enough cold water to the reserved liquid to measure 3 cups; pour into large saucepan. Bring to boil; remove from heat. Add gelatin; stir at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved.
Add cranberry sauce; stir until well blended. (Note: Due to the presence of whole berries in the cranberry sauce, the gelatin mixture will not be smooth.)
Pour into large bowl. Refrigerate 1-1/2 hours or until slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg whites).
STIR in remaining pineapple, apple and walnuts; stir gently until well blended. Pour into medium serving bowl.
REFRIGERATE 4 hours or until firm. Garnish with reserved crushed pineapple and additional apple slices just before serving. Store leftover gelatin in refrigerator.

recipes.title: Caesar Salad
recipes.description: Classic Caesar salad with two dressing options - traditional with egg yolks or almost fat-free version.

instructions.text: First rub your salad bowl with garlic.
For the traditional dressing, beat the eggs until they begin to thicken. Whisk the oil in, one tablespoon at a time; then add the remaining ingredients and whisk until smooth.
To make the low-fat version, combine the listed fat-free ingredients in a bowl and whisk smooth.
Toss lettuce and croutons in the dressing just before serving.

notes: Two dressing options provided
Traditional uses raw egg yolks - use pasteurized eggs if concerned
Fat-free version uses Kraft Free Mayonnaise
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 920.jpeg

recipes.title: Cornbread Salad
recipes.description: Southern layered cornbread salad with tomatoes, bacon, and mayonnaise - a potluck favorite.

instructions.text: Combine tomatoes, peppers, onion, pickles and bacon. Drain off excess juice and combine with mayonnaise.
Crumble cornbread and combine with vegetable mixture. Toss gently.
Spread mayonnaise over top. Cover and chill overnight.

notes: Must chill overnight for best flavor
Southern potluck classic

recipes.title: Texas Cornbread Salad
recipes.description: Hearty Texas-style cornbread salad with cream-style corn and prepared mustard.

instructions.text: Crumble together cornbread and bacon. Add tomatoes, onions, green pepper, salt, pepper, corn and mustard.
Stir in enough mayonnaise to moisten salad and make it hold together. (You may need more mayonnaise than specified.)
Refrigerate until serving time. Best if made a day ahead.

notes: Note: Make cornbread with yellow corn meal. Add 1 small can green chili peppers and a pinch of sage before baking.
Best if made a day ahead

recipes.title: Tennessee Cornbread Salad
recipes.description: Layered Tennessee-style cornbread salad with sweet pickle juice dressing.

instructions.text: Crumble half the cornbread into the bottom of a large serving bowl.
In another bowl, combine tomatoes, green pepper, onion, pickles and bacon, blending well. Spoon half the vegetable mixture over cornbread.
Stir together mayonnaise and pickle juice. Spread half the dressing over vegetables.
Repeat layers to use remaining ingredients. Garnish as desired.
Cover tightly and chill 2 to 3 hours before serving.

notes: Layered presentation
Pickle juice adds tangy flavor to dressing
Chill 2-3 hours minimum

recipes.title: Louis Pappas' Famous Greek Salad
recipes.description: Legendary composed Greek salad from Tampa's iconic Louis Pappas restaurant - an elaborate presentation with potato salad, feta, shrimp, and anchovies.

instructions.text: Make a salad from potatoes, onions, parsley, green onion and moisten with salad dressing.
Line platter with lettuce. Place 3 cups potato salad in a mound in the center of the platter. Cover with remaining lettuce that has been shredded.
Arrange watercress on top. Place tomatoes around the outer edge with a few on top. Place cucumber wedges between tomatoes, making a solid base.
Slices of feta should be arranged on the top, with green pepper slices over all. On the top, place sliced beets with a shrimp on each slice and an anchovy fillet on the shrimp.
Olives, radishes and green onions can be arranged as desired.
Sprinkle with vinegar, oil and oregano. Serve with garlic-topped, toasted Greek bread.

notes: Famous Tampa restaurant recipe
Elaborate composed presentation - a meal in itself
Louis Pappas is a Tampa Bay landmark

recipes.title: Carrot and Date Salad with Gorgonzola Dressing
recipes.source_note: From 'Down to Earth' by Georgeanne Brennan
recipes.description: Simple elegant salad with grated carrots, dates, and creamy Gorgonzola dressing.

ingredients.item: crumbled Gorgonzola, Maytag or other blue cheese
dandelion, arugula or young lettuce leaves

instructions.text: Using a vegetable peeler or paring knife, peel the carrots. Grate them on the large holes of a hand-held grater to make 1 cup. Set aside.
Chop the dates into pieces about the size of corn kernels and set them aside as well.
In a bowl, combine cheese, olive oil, vinegar and pepper, mashing and whisking the cheese to make a thick dressing.
Add carrots and dates to dressing and turn them until they are well-coated.
Transfer to a serving bowl or to individual salad plates and garnish with dandelion, arugula or lettuce. Serve at once.

notes: From Georgeanne Brennan's 'Down to Earth' cookbook
Serve immediately for best texture

recipes.title: Garlicky White Bean Salad
recipes.description: A flavorful white bean salad with garlic, herbs, and lemon - perfect for summer gatherings.

ingredients.prep_note: juice and grated rind [UNCLEAR - quantity cut off]

instructions.text: Cover beans with cold water and soak overnight.
Drain beans and place in a pan with the stock, garlic, bay leaves and thyme. Simmer until beans are tender-firm, about 1 hour.
Drain and discard bay leaf. Combine cooked beans with remaining ingredients except parsley in a glass bowl.
Cover and chill thoroughly. Garnish with parsley.

notes: Right side of recipe clipping is cut off - some ingredient quantities are unclear

flags: Partial text cut off on right side of clipping - some ingredients incomplete

recipes.title: Fruit Salad
recipes.description: A light fruit salad with canned fruits and sugar-free pudding mix for a creamy texture.

ingredients.item: crushed pineapple in its own juice

instructions.text: Mix pineapple and fruit cocktail together.
Add oranges and cherries, if desired.
Add sugar-free instant pudding mix, gradually add to desired pudding consistency.
Stir in bananas.
Refrigerate. Stir before serving.

notes: Using sugar-free pudding makes this a lighter dessert option

recipes.title: Chicken Waldorf Salad
recipes.source_note: Kraft General Foods / Miracle Whip recipe card, 1991
recipes.description: A classic Waldorf salad variation with cubed chicken, apples, celery, raisins, and walnuts in a creamy dressing.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until blended.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

notes: Can substitute mayonnaise for Miracle Whip if preferred

recipes.title: Janet's Cabbage Salad
recipes.description: Asian-style cabbage salad with ramen noodles, almonds, and sesame seeds.

instructions.text: Chop cabbage and onion, place in large bowl.
Brown broken ramen noodles and almonds (can toast in dry pan).
Add noodles, almonds, sesame seeds, and sunflower seeds to cabbage.
Whisk together sugar, vinegar, oil, and soy sauce for dressing.
Add sesame seeds to dressing if desired.
Pour dressing over salad and toss just before serving.

notes: Popular potluck salad
Don't add dressing until ready to serve to keep noodles crispy
Discard ramen seasoning packet or save for another use

recipes.title: Four Bean Salad
recipes.description: Classic marinated four-bean salad with sweet vinegar dressing.

instructions.text: Drain all canned beans and combine in a large bowl.
Slice green pepper and onion and add to beans.
In a separate bowl, combine oil, vinegar, sugar, and salt.
Stir until sugar dissolves.
Pour dressing over beans.
Let stand in refrigerator 24 hours before serving.
Drain before serving if desired.

notes: Must marinate 24 hours for best flavor
Classic potluck dish
Can use canned or fresh cooked beans
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 917.jpeg

recipes.title: Doris' Salad (Layered)
recipes.description: Make-ahead layered salad with lettuce, peas, cauliflower, and bacon.

instructions.text: Layer chopped lettuce in bottom of large bowl or 9x13 dish.
Add layer of uncooked (thawed) frozen peas.
Add layer of raw cauliflower pieces.
Add layer of crumbled bacon and sweet onion.
Frost the top with mayonnaise, spreading to edges to seal.
Sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Refrigerate for 24 hours.
Just before serving, toss and sprinkle generously with McCormick Salad Herbs.

notes: Must make 24 hours ahead
Don't toss until ready to serve
Mayo seals in freshness

recipes.title: Sweet and Pungent Bean Salad
recipes.description: Fresh string bean salad with sweet and tangy vinegar dressing.

ingredients.prep_note: or half green and half wax beans
low-salt canned beans may be used

instructions.text: Par-cook the beans until just barely tender. Drain, reserving liquid.
To the cooking liquid in pan, add sugar, seasonings, and vinegar.
Bring to a boil.
Put drained beans, onions, and green pepper in a bowl.
Add the boiling liquid mixture.
Cover and chill.
Drain and serve on lettuce, garnished with pimento strips.

notes: Use fresh beans for best texture
Can substitute canned low-salt beans for restricted diets

recipes.title: Layered Lettuce Salad (Witz Restaurant)
recipes.attribution: Witz Restaurant, East Cape Girardeau, Ill.
recipes.description: Restaurant-style 24-hour layered salad with creamy dressing.

ingredients.prep_note: washed and torn into bite-size pieces

instructions.text: In a 9-by-13-inch casserole dish, layer first the lettuce, then celery, then green pepper, then peas, then onion.
Mix together mayonnaise, salad oil, sugar, and Parmesan cheese.
Gently spread dressing over layered ingredients, sealing to edges.
Sprinkle cheddar cheese and bacon on top.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 24 hours.
Serve untossed, garnished with croutons.

notes: From Witz Restaurant, Route 146, East Cape Girardeau, Illinois
Must refrigerate 24 hours
Serve without tossing

recipes.title: Macaroni Salad (Neighbors)
recipes.description: Classic macaroni salad with tuna (or chicken/turkey), vegetables, and creamy dressing.

instructions.text: Cook macaroni in salted water until tender. Blanch in cold water and drain well.
Combine macaroni with celery, onion, optional radishes and cucumbers.
Chop hard-boiled eggs and add to mixture.
Drain tuna and flake into salad (or use chicken/turkey).
Make dressing: Mix mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Add dressing to salad and mix well.
Store in refrigerator overnight or make early in the morning for best flavor.

notes: Better if made ahead and refrigerated overnight
Can substitute chicken or turkey for tuna
Dated Late 1973

recipes.title: Chicken Salad (Simple)
recipes.description: Simple chicken salad with peas, celery, and olives.

instructions.text: Bone and chop chicken meat.
Cook peas and drain.
Chop celery and olives.
Combine all ingredients with salad dressing made with sugar and vinegar.

notes: Recipe is minimal/incomplete
Dressing proportions not specified

recipes.title: Beet Summer Salad
recipes.description: Warm beet and cucumber salad with honey-herb dressing and hard-cooked eggs.

instructions.text: Bring 2 quarts of water in saucepan to boiling. Add ½ tsp salt and 1 tbsp lemon juice.
Add beets; cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes. Drain; reserve broth for beet soup if desired.
Meanwhile, combine remaining salt and lemon juice, the honey and wine vinegar in large bowl; remove half of the mixture and reserve for dressing for greens.
Cut cucumbers into slices. Add to honey mixture in bowl; let stand to marinate.
When beets are cool enough to handle but still warm, remove skins. Slice in half; cut crosswise into ¼-inch-thick slices; place in bowl. Set aside, covered.
Remove cucumbers with slotted spoon from marinade and place in small saucepan. Add chicken broth; gently cook until liquid evaporates, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat.
Mix beets, parsley, dill and thyme in bowl.
Whisk oil into reserved honey mixture along with any marinade left over from cucumbers. Add greens; toss to coat.
Divide greens equally among 6 plates. Arrange beets, cucumbers and egg wedges on plates.
Serve warm or at room temperature with sour cream.

notes: Save beet cooking liquid for soup

recipes.title: Janet's Salad (Ramen Noodle Salad)
recipes.description: Crunchy Asian-style cabbage salad with toasted ramen noodles and almonds.

instructions.text: Chop cabbage and onion.
Brown broken ramen noodles and almonds in a pan. Add sesame seeds.
Make dressing: combine sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, and seasoning packet from ramen noodles.
Toss cabbage and onion with dressing.
Top with toasted noodles, almonds, and sesame seeds just before serving.

notes: Add crunchy toppings just before serving to maintain crunch

recipes.title: Broccoli Salad with Bacon and Eggs
recipes.description: Creamy broccoli salad with mashed hard-boiled eggs and crispy bacon.

instructions.text: Cut up broccoli into bite-size florets.
Add chopped onion.
Add mashed hard-boiled eggs.
Add crushed crispy bacon.
Mix dressing: mayo, vinegar (or lemon juice), a little sugar, salt and pepper.
Toss salad with dressing.

recipes.title: Cauliflower Layer Salad
recipes.description: A layered vegetable salad with cauliflower, lettuce, and Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: In a 9x12 inch dish: Use 1 layer of broken pieces of lettuce, 1 layer of cauliflower pieces, 1 layer of red onion, 1 layer of frozen peas, and 1 layer Parmesan cheese (grated).
Seal top with approximately 2 cups mayonnaise.
Set in refrigerator for overnight.
Toss when ready to serve.

Cool completely.
Add cherries, cherry juice, softened cream cheese, and Cool Whip. Nuts are optional.

recipes.title: Red, White, and Blue Salad
recipes.description: Patriotic layered gelatin salad with strawberry, cream, and blueberry layers.

instructions.text: Dissolve 1 package strawberry jello in 2 cups boiling water. Pour in 3 quart glass bowl; refrigerate until firmly set.
Dissolve unflavored gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water; set aside.
Dissolve sugar in whipping cream over low heat until nearly boiling. Remove from heat; add gelatin.
Cool. Add sour cream and vanilla; pour over first layer. Refrigerate till firm.
Dissolve raspberry jello in 1 cup boiling water; cool. Add berries and juice.
Pour over second layer. Refrigerate until firm.

notes: This recipe takes a long time but it's worth it!

recipes.title: Seven Layer Salad
recipes.description: Classic make-ahead layered salad with peas, bacon, and cheese.

recipes.description: Light and fluffy orange gelatin salad with cottage cheese and pineapple.

instructions.text: Drain the juice from oranges and pineapple.
Combine all together. Chill and serve.

Stir in cranberries, pineapple, and nuts.
Fold in Cool Whip.
Spread in 13x9 inch dish and freeze.
Serve on lettuce leaves.

recipes.title: Chef's Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic main-dish salad with meat, cheese, and fresh vegetables.

ingredients.item: fully cooked ham, chicken, turkey, beef, pork, or lamb
cubed Swiss, cheddar, American, provolone, or Gruyère cheese or crumbled blue cheese

ingredients.prep_note: cut into wedges, or 8 cherry tomatoes, halved

ingredients.item: small green or sweet red pepper
Creamy French Dressing, Buttermilk Dressing, Creamy Italian Dressing, or other salad dressing

instructions.text: In a large salad bowl toss together lettuce and romaine or spinach. Arrange meat or poultry, cheese, hard-cooked eggs, tomatoes, pepper rings, and green onions over the greens.
Sprinkle with Croutons, if desired. Pour Creamy French Dressing or other salad dressing over all. Toss to coat. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Note: To serve Chef's Salad as individual salads, toss together lettuce and romaine or spinach and divide among four individual salad bowls. Top each serving with one-fourth of the meat or poultry, cheese, hard-cooked eggs, tomatoes, pepper rings, and green onions. Sprinkle each with Croutons, if desired. Pass Creamy French Dressing or other salad dressing.

recipes.title: Taco Salads
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tex-Mex salad served in crispy tortilla cups with seasoned meat and all the fixings.

ingredients.item: ground beef, ground raw turkey, or bulk pork sausage

instructions.text: For meat mixture, in a large skillet cook meat and garlic till meat is no longer pink. Drain off fat. Stir in undrained kidney beans, taco sauce, and chili powder. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, for salads, combine lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, green pepper, olives, and green onions. Add hot meat mixture. Toss to mix. Divide among Tortilla Cups or individual salad plates.
Garnish with avocado, if desired. Serve with sour cream and additional taco sauce or salsa, if desired. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

Tortilla Cups: In a heavy 3-quart saucepan heat 2 inches cooking oil or melted shortening for deep-fat frying to 375°. Place one 7-inch flour tortilla on top of hot oil. Using a metal ladle, press tortilla into fat, forming the tortilla into a cup. Fry for 40 to 60 seconds or till golden. Remove with tongs. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with five more tortillas.

notes: Microwave directions available for meat mixture

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Caesar Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The classic anchovy and Parmesan salad with homemade croutons.

ingredients.prep_note: one can, drained, rinsed, and patted dry

instructions.text: Allow egg to come to room temperature. To coddle egg, add egg in shell to a small saucepan of boiling water. Remove from heat; let stand 1 minute. Remove egg from water and cool slightly.

Cut garlic clove in half lengthwise. Rub a large wooden salad bowl with cut sides of the garlic clove. Discard garlic. Add oil, lemon or lime juice, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce to bowl. Break the coddled egg into the bowl. Using a fork or a wire whisk, beat till creamy. Add romaine. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with croutons, Parmesan cheese, and pepper; toss to mix. Top with anchovy fillets. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Three-Bean Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic marinated bean salad that keeps well in the refrigerator.

ingredients.item: cut wax beans or 8 1/2-ounce can lima beans

instructions.text: Combine wax beans, green beans, red kidney beans, onion, and green pepper. For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine vinegar, oil, sugar, celery seed, and garlic. Cover and shake well. Add to vegetables; stir lightly.
Cover; chill for 4 to 24 hours, stirring often. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

Creamy Three-Bean Salad: Prepare as above, except omit salad oil and sugar. For dressing, combine 1/2 cup mayonnaise or salad dressing, 1 tablespoon vinegar, celery seed, 1 teaspoon prepared mustard, and garlic.

notes: EASY recipe tag in cookbook
Store any leftovers in the refrigerator for up to three days

recipes.title: Coleslaw
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic creamy coleslaw with cabbage and carrots.

ingredients.item: small green or sweet red pepper

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine cabbage, carrot, green or sweet red pepper, and green onions. For dressing, stir together mayonnaise or salad dressing, vinegar, sugar, and celery seed. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture; toss to coat.
Cover and chill for 1 to 24 hours. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

Vinaigrette Coleslaw: Prepare as above, except substitute vinaigrette for dressing. For vinaigrette, in a screw-top jar combine 1/4 cup vinegar, 3 tablespoons salad oil, 2 to 3 tablespoons sugar, and, if desired, several dashes bottled hot pepper sauce. Cover and shake well.

Nutty Citrus Coleslaw: Prepare as above, except omit green onions. Add 1 small orange, peeled, sliced, and chopped; 1/4 cup chopped walnuts; and 2 tablespoons raisins to the cabbage mixture. Makes 5 side-dish servings.

notes: Variations: Vinaigrette Coleslaw, Nutty Citrus Coleslaw

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Tabbouleh
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A classic Middle Eastern salad with bulgur (precooked cracked wheat).

instructions.text: Rinse bulgur in a colander with cold water. Drain. Combine bulgur, cucumber, parsley, and onions.
For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine oil, lemon juice, mint, garlic salt, and pepper. Cover; shake to mix. Pour over bulgur mixture. Toss to coat.
Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours. Before serving, stir in tomatoes. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Waldorf Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic apple salad with celery, nuts, and creamy dressing.

ingredients.item: raisins or snipped pitted whole dates
whipping cream or 1/3 cup frozen whipped dessert topping, thawed

instructions.text: In a bowl toss apple with lemon juice. Stir in celery, nuts, raisins, and, if desired, grapes.

For dressing, if using whipping cream, in a chilled mixing bowl whip cream to soft peaks. Fold mayonnaise into the whipped cream or dessert topping. Spread dressing over the top of the apple mixture. Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. To serve, fold dressing into fruit mixture. Makes 4 to 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Five-Cup Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Simple, sweet fruit salad with coconut and marshmallows.

instructions.text: Drain pineapple chunks, reserving 1 tablespoon syrup. Combine pineapple chunks, reserved syrup, mandarin orange sections, coconut, marshmallows, and sour cream.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. Before serving, sprinkle with pecans. Makes 6 side-dish servings.
Add juice of pineapple to the unflavored gelatin to dissolve.
Dissolve Jello in hot water, add cold water.
Put cranberries through a food grinder. Add sugar, mix well.
When Jello begins to thicken, fold in cranberry mix and remainder of ingredients.
Pour into a large mold or dish.
Chill until firm.

recipes.title: Bean and Sausage Bowl
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty main-dish salad with sausage, beans, and cheese

ingredients.item: thinly sliced salami, pepperoni, or summer sausage

instructions.text: Cut salami, pepperoni, or summer sausage slices into quarters. In a large bowl toss together meat, lettuce, kidney beans, hard-cooked eggs, celery, cheese, and green onions.
For dressing, stir together mayonnaise or salad dressing, milk, mustard, and horseradish; pour over meat mixture. Toss to coat. Makes 3 main-dish servings.

notes: Marked as FAST recipe

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for red kidney beans

recipes.title: Ham and Rice Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Colorful cold rice salad with ham and vegetables

ingredients.item: cold cooked long grain or brown rice

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 356, or other creamy salad dressing

instructions.text: Cook succotash according to package directions. Drain. In a large bowl stir together succotash, rice, ham, green pepper, tomato, onion, and parsley.
Pour salad dressing over rice mixture. Toss to coat. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Serve on lettuce-lined salad plates and garnish with sliced egg, if desired. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Italian-Style Pasta Toss
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Cold pasta salad with Italian meats, cheese, and vegetables

ingredients.item: chopped green or sweet red pepper

ingredients.prep_note: thinly sliced and separated into rings

instructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Rinse with cold water; drain again.
For salad, in a bowl toss together pasta, cubed cheese, salami, cauliflower, zucchini, green or red pepper, onion rings, olives, Parmesan cheese, and parsley.

For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine oil, vinegar, garlic, basil, oregano, and pepper. Cover and shake well. Pour over salad. Toss to coat. Cover; chill 4 to 24 hours. To serve, add tomatoes; toss gently. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Bratwurst and Pasta Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty pasta salad with bratwurst and Italian seasoning

ingredients.item: cavatelli, medium shell macaroni, or corkscrew macaroni
fresh broccoli or frozen cut broccoli

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 356, or other creamy salad dressing

instructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta; rinse with cold water. Drain again. Cut broccoli into 1-inch pieces. Cook broccoli in boiling salted water for 7 to 9 minutes or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen broccoli according to package directions.) Drain.
Toss together pasta, broccoli, bratwurst, tomatoes, and green onions. Stir Italian seasoning into salad dressing. Pour dressing mixture over salad.
Toss to coat. Cover; chill for 4 to 24 hours. Serve over lettuce and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, if desired. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

missing_inputs: Not in database: fully cooked smoked bratwurst
Not in database: dried Italian seasoning
assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for grated Parmesan cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Reuben Salads
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Deconstructed Reuben sandwich as a salad with rye croutons

instructions.text: Divide lettuce among 4 salad plates. Arrange sauerkraut, beef, cheese, and croutons over lettuce.
Combine salad dressing and caraway seed. Serve with salads. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Rye Croutons: Brush both sides of 2 slices rye bread with 4 teaspoons softened margarine or butter. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes. In a shallow baking pan spread bread cubes. Bake in a 300° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till dry, stirring once.

notes: Marked as FAST recipe

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chicken and Garbanzo Bean Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Southwestern-style chicken salad with beans and chili

ingredients.item: cubed cooked chicken, turkey, or beef
cubed cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: In a medium bowl combine chicken, garbanzo beans, cheese, celery, green pepper, and green onions.
For dressing, stir together mayonnaise, lemon juice, chili powder, garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir into chicken mixture.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. Before serving, stir mixture. Serve on lettuce-lined salad plates. Garnish with tomato wedges. Makes 4 or 5 main-dish servings.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for garbanzo beans

recipes.title: Chicken Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic chicken salad served in tomato shells

ingredients.item: finely chopped cooked chicken or turkey
ingredients.prep_note: or one 6 3/4-oz can chunk-style chicken, drained

ingredients.item: sweet pickle relish or chopped green pepper

instructions.text: Combine chicken, celery, green onions, lemon juice, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir in eggs, mayonnaise, pickle relish, and mustard. Cover; chill at least 1 hour.

Meanwhile, if using tomatoes, cut a thin slice off stem end of each tomato. Using a spoon, scoop out the centers of tomatoes, leaving 1/4- to 1/2-inch-thick shells. Reserve pulp for another use. Serve salad in tomato shells or on lettuce leaves. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

notes: Tuna Salad: Prepare as above, except substitute one 6 1/2-oz can tuna, drained and broken into chunks, for the chicken. Omit mustard.

Salmon Salad: Prepare as above, except substitute one 7 3/4-oz can salmon, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed, for the chicken. Omit pickle relish and mustard; add 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed with the eggs.
Ham Salad: Prepare as above, except substitute finely chopped fully cooked ham for the chopped chicken.

recipes.title: Avocado-Shrimp Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Creamy shrimp salad with avocado and cream cheese dressing

instructions.text: For dressing, in a blender container combine avocado, buttermilk, cream cheese, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and hot sauce. Cover and blend till smooth.
Arrange shrimp, tomatoes, and cheese over lettuce. If desired, sprinkle with pepper. Drizzle with dressing. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Crab Louis
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic West Coast crab salad with Louis dressing

ingredients.prep_note: 6-oz, thawed, or two 7-oz cans crabmeat, chilled, drained, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: Remove 4 large leaves from lettuce head. Set aside. Tear remaining lettuce into bite-size pieces.
On each of 4 salad plates, place one lettuce leaf. Top with torn lettuce. Reserve four large pieces of crabmeat. Flake remaining crabmeat. Arrange flaked crabmeat, tomatoes, and eggs on lettuce.
Drizzle with Louis Dressing. Sprinkle with paprika. Garnish with the reserved crabmeat and lemon. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Louis Dressing: Mix 1/2 cup mayonnaise or salad dressing, 1/4 cup finely chopped green pepper, 1/4 cup finely chopped green onion, 2 tablespoons chili sauce, 1 tablespoon milk, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and dash Worcestershire sauce. Beat 1/4 cup whipping cream to soft peaks. Fold whipped cream into mayonnaise mixture.

recipes.title: Salad Niçoise
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic French composed salad with tuna, eggs, and vegetables

ingredients.prep_note: drained, rinsed, and patted dry, optional
see recipe, page 358, or other oil and vinegar salad dressing

instructions.text: Toss together romaine and lettuce. Arrange greens on a large platter. Drain tuna; break tuna into chunks. Mound in center of greens.
Arrange green beans, hard-cooked eggs, potato slices, cherry tomatoes, green pepper, onion, olives, and, if desired, anchovies around tuna. Drizzle with Vinaigrette. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

notes: Salmon Salad Niçoise: Prepare as above, except substitute one 7 3/4-oz can chunk salmon, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed, for the tuna.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.0 cups) for chunk white tuna

recipes.title: Salmon Pasta Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Creamy salmon salad with pasta and vegetables

ingredients.item: corkscrew, medium shell, or wagon wheel macaroni

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 356, or other buttermilk salad dressing
15 1/2-oz, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed

instructions.text: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Immediately transfer hot macaroni to a large bowl. Add cream cheese and Buttermilk Dressing. Toss till the macaroni is coated and mixture is blended.
Stir in milk and dill. Add salmon, cucumber, tomato, and green onions. Toss lightly to mix. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Gazpacho-Style Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh vegetable salad inspired by Spanish gazpacho soup

ingredients.prep_note: thinly sliced and separated into rings

ingredients.item: snipped fresh basil or dried basil

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine tomatoes, cucumber, green pepper, onion, and parsley.
For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine oil, vinegar, sugar, garlic, basil, cumin, mustard, and hot pepper sauce. Cover and shake well. Pour over vegetable mixture; toss lightly to coat.
Cover and chill for 2 to 3 hours, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a salad bowl. Garnish with croutons and avocado slices, if desired. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Greens with Basil Vinaigrette
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Mixed greens with apple, mushrooms, and pineapple-basil dressing

ingredients.item: snipped fresh basil or dried basil

instructions.text: For salad, place salad greens in a large salad bowl. Top with apple and mushroom slices.

For vinaigrette, in a screw-top jar combine pineapple juice, vinegar, salad oil, basil, salt, and pepper. Cover and shake well. Drizzle vinaigrette over salad. Toss to mix. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Marinated Mushroom Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh mushrooms marinated in tangy herb dressing

instructions.text: For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine lemon juice, salad oil, mustard, sugar, salt, basil, and pepper. Cover and shake well.
Pour dressing over mushrooms; toss to coat. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, in a large salad bowl combine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, and carrots. Top with mushroom mixture. Toss to coat all with dressing. Makes 4 to 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Spinach and Garbanzo Bean Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh spinach salad with beans, vegetables, and avocado dressing

ingredients.prep_note: thinly sliced and separated into rings

instructions.text: For dressing, mash half of the avocado. Stir together mashed avocado, sour cream, lemon juice, celery salt, and hot pepper sauce. Stir in milk till desired consistency. Cover and chill while preparing salad.
For salad, combine spinach, garbanzo beans, tomatoes, cucumber, cauliflower, mushrooms, onion, and walnuts. Slice one hard-cooked egg.

Slice remaining avocado half; brush with additional lemon juice, if desired. Add sliced egg and avocado to salad. Top with dressing; toss to mix. Cut the remaining egg into wedges. Garnish salad with egg wedges. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Marinated Vegetable Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Colorful mixed vegetables in herb-oregano marinade

instructions.text: Cook 2 cups small cauliflower flowerets, 2 cups bias-sliced green beans cut into 1-inch pieces, 2 medium carrots, thinly sliced; 1 cup coarsely chopped green pepper; and 1 medium onion, sliced and separated into rings, in a small amount of boiling water for 5 minutes or till crisp-tender.
Drain; transfer to a bowl. Stir in 1 small zucchini, thinly sliced, and 1/4 cup halved pitted ripe olives.

For marinade, in a screw-top jar combine 1/2 cup white wine vinegar; 1/3 cup salad oil; 2 teaspoons sugar; 1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano, crushed; 1/2 teaspoon salt; and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cover and shake well. Pour marinade over hot vegetables. Cover; chill for 4 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally. Serve with a slotted spoon. Makes 8 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Wilted Spinach Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Warm spinach salad with hot bacon dressing

instructions.text: Combine spinach, mushrooms, and green onion. If desired, sprinkle with pepper. Set aside.

In a 12-inch skillet cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon, reserving drippings in skillet. Crumble bacon; set aside. Stir vinegar, sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon salt into drippings. Heat to boiling; remove from heat. Add the spinach mixture. Toss till coated.
Transfer to a serving dish. Top with chopped egg and bacon. Serve immediately. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

notes: Microwave directions: Combine spinach, mushrooms, and onion. If desired, sprinkle with pepper. Set aside. In a 2-quart casserole microwave bacon, covered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 5 minutes or till crisp. Remove bacon, reserving drippings in casserole. Crumble bacon; set aside. Stir vinegar, sugar, and salt into drippings. Cook, covered, for 30 to 45 seconds or till boiling. Add spinach mixture. Toss till coated. Top with chopped egg and bacon. Serve immediately.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Creamy Cucumbers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Cool cucumber slices in creamy sour cream dressing

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

ingredients.prep_note: halved lengthwise and thinly sliced (about 3 cups)
thinly sliced and separated into rings

instructions.text: Stir together sour cream; vinegar; sugar; dillweed, if desired; 1 teaspoon salt and dash pepper.
Add cucumber and onion slices; toss to coat. Cover; chill for 2 to 48 hours, stirring often. Stir before serving. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

notes: Marinated Cucumbers: Prepare as above, except omit sour cream and dillweed. Increase vinegar or lemon juice to 1/4 cup and sugar to 2 tablespoons. If desired, stir 1/2 teaspoon celery seed into vinegar mixture. Cover and chill for 2 hours or up to 5 days, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Pea-Cheese Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Colorful salad with peas, cheese, and hard-cooked eggs

ingredients.item: diced pimiento or sweet red pepper

instructions.text: Cook frozen peas according to package directions. Thoroughly drain the cooked or canned peas. Cool cooked peas.
In a large bowl combine peas, cheese cubes, hard-cooked eggs, celery, onion, and pimiento or sweet red pepper. Combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, salt, and pepper. Add to pea mixture; toss to mix.

Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Stir mixture well. If desired, cut each tomato into 8 wedges, cutting to, but not through, the bottom. Place tomatoes atop lettuce. Fill tomatoes with pea mixture. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: 24-Hour Vegetable Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Layered make-ahead salad with vegetables, bacon, and cheese

ingredients.item: torn iceberg lettuce, romaine, leaf lettuce, Bibb lettuce, or fresh spinach
sliced fresh mushrooms or broccoli flowerets, or frozen peas
shredded Swiss, American, or cheddar cheese

instructions.text: Place lettuce or spinach in the bottom of a bowl, about 8 inches in diameter. If desired, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Layer mushrooms, broccoli, or peas atop. Then layer carrots. Arrange egg slices and bacon over vegetables.

Top with 1/2 cup of the cheese and the green onions. For dressing, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, and, if desired, dillweed. Spread dressing over top of salad, sealing to edge of bowl. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. Before serving, toss to coat the vegetables. Sprinkle with additional sliced green onion, if desired. Makes 6 to 8 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Carrot-Raisin Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Sweet and crunchy carrot salad with raisins and apples

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine carrots, apple, and raisins. Sprinkle with lemon juice.
Add mayonnaise or salad dressing. Stir gently to coat well. Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. (If dressing becomes too thick, stir in a little milk.)
Before serving, sprinkle with toasted almonds, if desired. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Creamy Potato Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic American potato salad with eggs and mustard

instructions.text: In a covered saucepan cook potatoes in boiling water for 20 to 25 minutes or till just tender; drain well. Peel and cube potatoes.
In a very large bowl combine celery, green pepper, onion, mayonnaise or salad dressing, vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add potatoes and eggs. Toss lightly to mix.
Cover and chill for 6 to 24 hours. Makes 12 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Marinated Potato Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant potato salad with artichoke hearts and vinaigrette

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 358, or other oil and vinegar dressing

instructions.text: In a covered saucepan cook potatoes in boiling salted water for 15 to 20 minutes or just till tender; drain well. Cut potatoes into quarters.
In a large bowl pour dressing over potatoes. Add artichoke hearts, green pepper, tomatoes, onion, olives, and parsley. Toss gently to mix.
Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with kale leaf, if desired. Makes 4 or 5 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: German-Style Potato Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Warm potato salad with bacon and tangy dressing

ingredients.prep_note: chopped; 2 slices bacon, cooked, drained, and crumbled, optional

instructions.text: In a covered saucepan cook potatoes in boiling salted water for 20 to 25 minutes or till just tender; drain well. Cool slightly. Peel and slice potatoes. Set aside while preparing dressing.
For dressing, in a large skillet cook 4 slices bacon till crisp. Drain and crumble, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Set the bacon aside. Add chopped onion to reserved drippings. Cook till tender.

Stir in flour, sugar, salt, celery seed, and pepper. Stir in water and vinegar. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in potatoes and bacon. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or till heated through, stirring gently. Season to taste.
Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with hard-cooked egg, parsley, or additional bacon, if desired. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Cajun-Style Rice Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Spicy rice salad with shrimp and Cajun seasonings

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl gently stir together rice, green pepper, shrimp, mushrooms, hard-cooked egg, and parsley. Set aside.
For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine salad oil, vinegar, water, paprika, horseradish, onion salt, and red pepper. Cover and shake well. Pour dressing over rice mixture. Toss to coat.
Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Serve on lettuce leaves. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

assumptions: Used standard can size (0.5 cups) for shrimp

recipes.title: Barley Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Nutty grain salad with barley, carrots, and lemon

ingredients.item: fresh snipped basil or dried basil
chopped peanuts or cashews, or toasted slivered almonds

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine chicken broth and barley. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes or till liquid is absorbed.
In a mixing bowl combine barley, carrot, and parsley. For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine water, salad oil, lemon juice, basil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cover and shake well.
Pour dressing over barley mixture. Toss to coat. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Stir in nuts before serving. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Fruit Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Warm fruit salad with cinnamon-apricot dressing

instructions.text: For dressing, in a blender container or food processor bowl place undrained apricots. Cover and blend or process till smooth.
In a saucepan combine blended apricots, sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove cinnamon.
Meanwhile, in a mixing bowl stir together orange slices and pineapple chunks. Add dressing; stirring carefully to coat. Cover and chill for several hours.
Just before serving, stir in strawberry halves. Spoon fruit mixture onto 6 lettuce-lined plates. If desired, garnish with fresh mint sprigs. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for unpeeled apricot halves
Used standard can size (1.5 cups) for pineapple chunks
Assumed 1 unit for fresh mint sprigs

recipes.title: Fruit-Filled Melons
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Cantaloupe bowls filled with fresh fruit and ginger dressing

instructions.text: Cut each cantaloupe in half and remove the seeds. Use a melon baller to scoop out pulp, reserving shells. Set aside 2 cups melon balls; reserve remaining melon for another use. Trim a thin slice from the bottom of each melon shell.
In a bowl mix the 2 cups melon balls, orange, apple, peach, blueberries, and strawberries. For dressing, stir together yogurt, mayonnaise, brown sugar, and gingerroot.
Line each melon shell with lettuce leaves. Divide fruit among melon shells. Top each with one fourth of the dressing. Makes 4 side-dish servings.
Note: If desired, sprinkle with lemon juice to keep fruit from darkening (see tip, page 351).

recipes.title: Lime Coconut in Pineapple
recipes.description: A refreshing lime gelatin salad with pineapple and coconut.

instructions.text: Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir until dissolved.
Add pineapple juice. Chill until partially set.
Fold in drained pineapple and coconut.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour into mold or dish.
Refrigerate until firm.

recipes.title: Vegetable Mix Salad

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine canned vegetables, potato, celery and onion. Toss lightly.
To prepare dressing, in separate bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Mix well.
Add dressing to vegetables. Toss gently. Cover. Chill for at least 1 hour.
On a serving platter or in a bowl, mound salad. Surround with beets. Garnish with parsley.

notes: Recipe may be doubled. Tips: To make this dish into a satisfying brunch, add a small can of drained shrimp to salad.
Good served with: Roast lamb, rice pilaf, glazed carrots, and brownies for dessert.

assumptions: chopped green onion: used default unit

recipes.title: Garden Leaf Salad

instructions.text: To prepare dressing, in a small bowl, whisk together all ingredients. Blend well. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Chill.
Gently tear lettuce. Place in a large serving bowl. Add radishes and eggs.
Pour dressing over salad. Toss. Season with pepper, if desired.

notes: For best flavor, serve this salad slightly chilled. Any member of the Butterhead lettuce family is fine for this recipe. Varieties include Bibb, Boston and Buttercrunch. Recipe may be halved or doubled.

recipes.title: Asian Chicken Salad

ingredients.item: KFC Breast (with corn, coleslaw and a biscuit)

instructions.text: Discard the chicken skin and shred the meat from a KFC Breast.
Whisk 1 tablespoon each rice vinegar, low-sodium soy sauce, brown sugar, 1 teaspoon grated ginger, 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes and 1 tablespoon sesame oil.
Toss the chicken with the salad. Cut the biscuit into cubes and toss with the salad; pepper to taste. Toast in a 350°F oven until crunchy, then sprinkle over the salad.

notes: The makeover cuts the fat by 80 percent while keeping the Colonel's secret herbs and spices.

recipes.title: Smoked Trout and Grapefruit Salad

ingredients.item: kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
Bibb lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces
smoked trout, skin discarded and fish flaked

instructions.text: Grate ¼ teaspoon zest from the grapefruit and set aside. Trim the ends from the grapefruit, then cut away the peel and white pith. Working over a bowl, cut along both sides of each membrane with a paring knife to remove the segments. Discard any seeds. Cut the grapefruit segments into pieces. Squeeze the juice from the membranes into the bowl.
Make the dressing: Whisk the sour cream, 2 tablespoons of the grapefruit juice, the grapefruit zest, scallions, 2 tablespoons water and ½ teaspoon each salt and pepper in a bowl.

Toss the watercress, endive, lettuce, celery and onion in a large bowl. Add the dressing and toss to coat. Divide the salad among shallow bowls. Top with the reserved grapefruit segments and the smoked trout.

notes: This salad also tastes great with ham or smoked chicken from the deli.

ingredients.item: extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°. Put a ¼-inch layer of salt in the bottom of a small baking dish. Place the beets on top of the salt, making sure they are not touching each other. Cover the beets with the remaining salt (save some for seasoning) and bake until fork-tender, about 1 hour, 15 minutes. Remove the beets from the salt and let cool to room temperature.
Meanwhile, make the dressing: Puree the goat cheese, crème fraîche, olive oil, vinegar and shallot in a blender until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Heat the vegetable oil in a small skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the sage leaves and fry until crisp, 5 to 10 seconds. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain; season lightly with salt.

Peel the beets (the skins will slip right off) and slice into thin rounds using a mandoline or sharp knife. Divide the beet slices among plates. Spoon some of the goat cheese dressing on top. Put the arugula in a bowl, drizzle with the lemon juice and olive oil, season with salt and toss. Add the arugula salad to the plates; drizzle with more goat cheese dressing, if desired. Top with the pine nuts and fried sage.

recipes.title: Tuna Nicoise Salad
recipes.description: Classic French composed salad with tuna, potatoes, green beans, eggs, and olives.

ingredients.item: cooked tuna steaks or canned tuna

instructions.text: Cook the potatoes until just tender, cool in ice water and peel and quarter.
Top and tail the beans and boil in water for 5 minutes, cool in ice water.
Tear the lettuce into small pieces and arrange on a large plate.
Chop the tomatoes into quarters and add to the plate.
Cut the tuna into large chunks and add to the plate.
Add the potatoes, beans, sliced onion, eggs, olives and scatter over the chopped parsley.
In a small bowl mix the oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper. Pour over the salad and serve.

recipes.title: Fattoosh
recipes.description: Traditional Lebanese bread salad with crispy pita, fresh vegetables, sumac, and mint.

instructions.text: Set your oven to 425 degrees before doing anything else.
Put pita in a baking dish. Bake pita for 5 mins in the oven.
Remove the baking dish and set it to the side for cooling. Now break the pita into small pieces.
Grab the following ingredients: green peppers, lettuce, radishes, tomatoes, olives, onions, cucumber and the baked pita pieces.
Put all of the ingredients into a salad bowl and add: salt, mint, and sumac. Toss evenly.
Add some olive oil and lemon juice. Chill the salad in the fridge.
Enjoy.

notes: Chill the salad in the fridge.

recipes.title: Lebanese Rubbed Salad
recipes.description: A fresh salad with mixed greens, feta cheese, and balsamic vinegar, hand-mixed for even coating.

instructions.text: To begin let's get a big container (possibly a big bowl).
Into our container add the following items: feta cheese, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and some garlic.
Also combine with the items some salt and pepper. Make sure you combine the mixture well by tossing.
Now we want to add some olive oil and vinegar to the mix for extra tastiness.
Now let's make sure we have some clean hands and mix everything together for about two mins.
Our goal is getting the greens nice and evenly covered. Once the greens are coated evenly the dish is ready for plating.
Serve and enjoy.

recipes.title: Lebanese Bean Salad
recipes.description: A hearty three-bean salad with fava beans, chickpeas, and white beans marinated in lemon and garlic.

instructions.text: To make this recipe let's start with a large dish for mixing (possibly a bowl) and place into our container the following items: juiced lemon, fava beans, garlic, chickpeas, olive oil, white beans, and some parsley.
Combine with the mixture some black pepper and some salt.
Put the container in the fridge for about two hrs to let everything marinate and cool off.
Plate, enjoy.

notes: Put the container in the fridge for about two hours to let everything marinate and cool off.

recipes.title: Lebanese Radish Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing salad with crisp radishes, toasted walnuts, mint ribbons, and honey-lemon dressing.

ingredients.prep_note: trimmed and sliced into thin rounds

instructions.text: To make this salad we first need to grab a frying pan or skillet. Get the pan nice and hot with a medium level of heat and throw into the pan your walnuts.

Cook the walnuts until they are toasted and you smell their nice fragrance. You'll notice the colour of the walnuts change to a darker one when they are ready for the next step. This should take about 4 mins.
Once the walnuts are toasted, we want to dice them nicely.
Grab a container and place into it some radishes.
Grab another container (but smaller) and place the following it: honey, oil, salt, and juiced lemons.
Mix the contents together in the small bowl. Take this mixture and cover the radishes with it evenly. You may want to toss the radishes to get your even coating.
Now we want to grab some mint leaves and place them on top of each other in layers on the counter. Once layered, roll them up, and cut them to create a ribbon like shape.
Take your mint ribbons and combine them with the radishes and the walnuts.
Serve as is. Enjoy.

recipes.title: Tabouli
recipes.description: A refreshing Lebanese salad of bulgur wheat, fresh herbs, tomatoes, and lemon-olive oil dressing.

instructions.text: Pour boiling water over bulgur, cover and let sit 20 minutes.
Combine bulgur with all other ingredients. Toss and refrigerate 1 hour.

recipes.title: Cucumber Tomato Salad
recipes.description: From the colors alone, you can tell this cucumber tomato salad will be bursting with fresh flavors. The feta cheese adds a layer of tang and creaminess. Chilling time aside, this recipe is ready in a matter of minutes.

ingredients.item: 1 large English cucumber, halved and sliced
1 medium red onion, halved and thinly sliced

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the cucumber slices, grape tomato halves and sliced red onion. Add the vinaigrette and toss to coat. Refrigerate, covered, until you’re ready to serve. Just before serving, stir in the crumbled feta cheese and serve with a slotted spoon. Editor’s Tip: To avoid a watery salad, you can salt the tomatoes and cucumber first then discard the liquid. The salt draws out excess moisture.

recipes.title: Berry-Beet Salad
recipes.description: Here's a delightfully different salad that balances the earthy flavor of beets with the natural sweetness of berries. If you prefer, substitute crumbled feta for the goat cheese.

ingredients.item: 1 each fresh red and golden beets

instructions.text: Place beets in an 8-in. square baking dish; add 1 in. of water. Cover and bake at 400° for 30-40 minutes or until tender.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk the vinegar, oil, honey, salt and pepper; set aside. Cool beets; peel and cut into thin slices.

In a large bowl, combine the beets, berries, walnuts and shallot. Pour dressing over beet mixture and toss gently to coat. Divide salad greens among 4 serving plates. Top with beet mixture; sprinkle with cheese and basil.

recipes.title: Classic Cobb Salad
recipes.description: Making this salad is a lot like putting in a garden. I plant everything in nice, neat sections, just as I do with seedlings.

ingredients.item: 1 medium ripe avocado, peeled and chopped
Optional: Sliced ripe olives and lemon wedges

instructions.text: Place lettuce on a platter or in a large serving bowl. Arrange remaining ingredients in rows or sections as desired. Serve with dressing of choice; if desired, serve with sliced ripe olives and lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Corn ‘n’ Cucumbers Salad
recipes.description: This cucumber corn salad was one of my mother's recipes and I think of her whenever I make it. It's a nice change from a regular cucumber salad.

ingredients.item: 2 medium cucumbers, peeled and thinly sliced

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and chill for several hours.

recipes.title: Garden Bounty Panzanella Salad
recipes.description: My sister gave me fresh tomatoes and basil, so I made a bread salad known as Panzanella. The longer it sits, the more the bread soaks up the seasonings.

ingredients.item: 12 ounces French or ciabatta bread, cut into 1-inch cubes (about 12 cups)
1 medium green pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 medium sweet yellow pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced

instructions.text: In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons oil over medium heat. Add half of the bread cubes; cook and stir until toasted, about 8 minutes. Remove from pan. Repeat with remaining oil and bread cubes.
Combine bread cubes, tomatoes, cucumber, peppers, onion, basil, cheese, salt and pepper. Toss with dressing.

recipes.title: Honey-Mustard Brussels Sprouts Salad
recipes.description: Even if you dislike Brussels sprouts, you will love this dish. The dressing is so tasty, and it pairs amazingly with the apples, grapes and walnuts. You can also add whatever cheese, nuts or fruit you prefer.

ingredients.item: 1 pound fresh Brussels sprouts, trimmed and shredded

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the first 8 ingredients. In a small bowl, whisk remaining ingredients; pour over salad. Toss to coat.

recipes.title: Kiwi-Strawberry Spinach Salad
recipes.description: This pretty strawberry kiwi salad is always a hit when I serve it! The recipe came from a cookbook, but I personalized it. Sometimes just a small change in ingredients can create a big difference.

instructions.text: Place the first 5 ingredients in a blender; cover and process 30 seconds or until blended. Transfer to a small bowl; stir in green onions, sesame seeds and poppy seeds.
In a large bowl, combine spinach, strawberries and kiwi. Drizzle with dressing; toss to coat.

recipes.title: Quick Corn Salad
recipes.description: This sensational yet easy corn salad is a delight to serve because you can make it ahead, and it's an easy way to put garden bounty to good use. With colorful ingredients like corn, tomato and green pepper, it's also pretty in the bowl and on your plate.

ingredients.item: 2 cups fresh or frozen sweet corn

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine vegetables; stir in dressing. Cover and refrigerate until serving.

recipes.title: Radish Cucumber Salad
recipes.description: I put this cucumber radish salad together with vegetables I had left in my garden. My family liked it so much, I started taking it to community suppers and was often asked for the recipe. It's a refreshing accompaniment for any entree.

instructions.text: In a serving bowl, combine the cucumber, radishes and onion. In a second bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over vegetables and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Roasted Apple Salad with Spicy Maple-Cider Vinaigrette
recipes.description: We bought loads of apples and needed to use them. To help the flavors come alive, I roasted the apples and tossed them with a sweet dressing.

ingredients.item: 4 medium Fuji, Gala or other firm apples, quartered
1 package (5 ounces) spring mix salad greens
1 log (4 ounces) fresh goat cheese, crumbled

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°. Place apples in a foil-lined 15x10x1-in. baking pan; drizzle with oil and toss to coat. Roast until tender, 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool completely.
In a small bowl, whisk dressing ingredients until blended. In a large bowl, combine salad greens and dates. Drizzle dressing over salad and toss to coat.
Divide mixture among 8 plates. Top with goat cheese and roasted apples; sprinkle with pecans. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Shrimp Avocado Salad
recipes.description: Shrimp avocado salad mixes tender shellfish with fresh vegetables for a cool, protein-filled lunch or easy light dinner.

ingredients.item: 1 pound peeled and deveined cooked shrimp, coarsely chopped
3 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, tomatoes, green and red onions, jalapeno and serrano peppers, and cilantro. In a separate small bowl, mix the lime juice, vinegar, oil and adobo seasoning. Stir the dressing into the shrimp mixture.
Cover the bowl. Place it in the refrigerator until the flavors blend, about one hour.

Gently stir in the avocados. Serve the salad over lettuce or in lettuce leaves, alongside lime wedges. Editor's Tip: To make lettuce cups, cut out the white central core from a head of Bibb lettuce. Hold the head in your palm under cold running water, and carefully peel off the crunchy outer leaves, teasing each loose to stay whole. Pat the leaves dry with a clean tea towel before cradling the shrimp filling.

recipes.title: Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing
recipes.description: This spinach salad with warm bacon dressing proves that it's not difficult to get through an entire bag of spinach if it's dressed in a tangy, mustardy, brown-sugar bacon vinaigrette. Customize this classic salad with any toppings you like.

instructions.text: In a skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp, stirring occasionally. Using a slotted spoon, remove bacon to paper towels. Discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings.
Add vinegar, garlic, brown sugar, mustard and seasonings to drippings; heat through, stirring to blend. Transfer to a small bowl; gradually whisk in oil. Stir in half of the bacon.
Place spinach, onion and eggs in a large bowl; toss with warm dressing. Sprinkle with remaining bacon; serve immediately.

recipes.title: Strawberry-Blue Cheese Steak Salad
recipes.description: At lunch one day, a friend told me about a steak salad she'd had at a party. It sounded so fantastic I had to try it for myself. My family would eat it nonstop if we could. Can't seem to get enough of that tangy dressing!

ingredients.item: 1 beef top sirloin steak (3/4 inch thick and 1 pound)

instructions.text: Season steak with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add steak; cook 5-7 minutes on each side until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 135°; medium, 140°; medium-well, 145°). Remove from pan; let stand 5 minutes. Cut steak into bite-sized strips; toss with lime juice.
On a platter, combine romaine, strawberries and onion; top with steak. Sprinkle with cheese and walnuts. Serve with vinaigrette.

recipes.title: Tangerine Tossed Salad
recipes.description: My mother taught me how to cook when I was a young girl. The sweet tangerines and crunchy caramelized almonds make this one of my favorite recipes.

instructions.text: In a small skillet, cook and stir the almonds and 2 tablespoons sugar over medium-low heat for 25-30 minutes or until the sugar is melted and the almonds are toasted. Remove from the heat. Peel and section the tangerines, reserving 1 tablespoon juice.

In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, green onions, tangerines and almonds. In a small bowl, whisk the vinegar, oil, salt, pepper, reserved 1 tablespoon tangerine juice and remaining 1 tablespoon sugar. Pour over salad; toss to coat.

recipes.title: Tangy Cilantro Lime Confetti Salad
recipes.description: I love standout salads that burst with flavor

ingredients.item: 2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed
1 cup fresh or frozen corn, thawed

instructions.text: Place the first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Place dressing ingredients in a blender; cover and process until creamy and light in color. Pour over vegetable mixture; toss to coat. Refrigerate, covered, up to 3 hours.

recipes.title: Tomato Cucumber Mozzarella Salad
recipes.description: The fresher the ingredients, the tastier this tomato cucumber mozzarella salad will be. What's more, you can mix and match parts of this recipe to fit your preferences and use up what's already in your kitchen.

ingredients.item: 1 English cucumber, quartered and cut into 1/4-inch slices

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, cucumber, green pepper, onions, olives, parsley and basil. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegars, sugar, salt, oregano and pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Cover the salad and refrigerate it for at least 15 minutes. Just before serving, toss in the cheese. Serve the salad with a slotted spoon.

recipes.title: Tomato-Melon Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Nothing says summer like picking watermelon, tomatoes and raspberries, then tossing them together in a salad. The addition of grilled chicken makes it a satisfying summery meal.

ingredients.item: 4 grilled chicken breasts (4 ounces each), sliced

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, watermelon and raspberries. In a small bowl, whisk the basil, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper. Drizzle over tomato mixture; toss to coat. Divide salad greens among 6 serving plates; top with tomato mixture and chicken.

recipes.title: Twisted Eggs Benedict Salad
recipes.description: Salad for breakfast? Absolutely. You can prep everything except the dressing and chill it overnight. In the morning, dress the salad and poach the eggs.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 pounds fresh asparagus, trimmed and chopped
8 ounces diced deli ham or Canadian bacon
6 cups baby kale salad blend (about 4 ounces)
1 cup chopped roasted sweet red peppers

instructions.text: In a large nonstick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Add asparagus, fennel and ham; saute until vegetables are crisp-tender, about 8 minutes. Cool 3 minutes.
Toss vegetable mixture with salad blend, peppers and green onions. Whisk together mustard, vinegar, salt, pepper and the remaining oil until smooth.

In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil; reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Break eggs, 1 at a time, into a small bowl; slip eggs into water. Poach, uncovered, until whites are completely set and yolks begin to thicken, 3-5 minutes.
Meanwhile, toss salad with dressing. Divide salad among 8 plates. Using a slotted spoon, remove eggs from water; place 1 on top of each salad.

recipes.title: Zucchini Panzanella Salad
recipes.description: I learned how to make panzanella from my friend's grandmother. Once I discovered how to make the perfect vinaigrette, it became a dish I crave during the summer. It's also a great way to use day-old bread and your garden's bounty of zucchini.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 cups heirloom mini or cherry tomatoes, halved

instructions.text: Place zucchini in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Toss with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Bake, uncovered, at 400° until tender and lightly browned, 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through. Remove from the oven and cool.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, toss bread cubes with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Transfer to a baking sheet. Bake at 400° until lightly browned, 12-14 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Place the cooled zucchini, toasted bread, tomatoes, green pepper and red onion in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, garlic, seasonings and remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Drizzle over salad; toss gently to combine. Add the mozzarella and stir to combine. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Barley Corn Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: A terrific alternative to pasta salad, this colorful side dish adds refreshing herb flavor to corn, barley, and red and green peppers. Bring it to your next get-together and see how fast it disappears!

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients. In a jar with a tight-fitting lid, combine the lemon juice, oil, salt, thyme and pepper; shake well. Drizzle over salad and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.title: Steak Salad
recipes.description: This classic steak salad recipe features a perfectly cooked, well-seasoned steak atop a hearty mix of greens and toppings. It's a nutritious and quick dinner perfect for any night of the week.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme or 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1 beef flat iron steak or top sirloin steak (3/4 pound)
1/2 medium ripe avocado, peeled and thinly sliced
Optional: Crumbled blue cheese and additional pepper

instructions.text: For the dressing, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, thyme, salt and pepper. Place the steak and 1/4 cup dressing in a shallow dish and turn to coat the steak with the marinade. Refrigerate for eight hours or overnight. Reserve the remaining dressing: Simply cover and refrigerate it until serving time.

When ready to cook the steak, drain the beef and discard the marinade. Grill the steak, covered, over medium heat. You can also broil it in a pan set 4 inches from the heat source. Cook the meat until it reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare steak, a thermometer should read 135°F; for medium, 140°). That will take about six to eight minutes per side, depending on how thick it is. Let the steak stand for 5 minutes before slicing.

To serve, divide salad greens among four plates. Top with the sliced steak, tomatoes, radishes and avocado; sprinkle with cranberries and, if desired, cheese and pepper. Serve with the reserved dressing. Editor's Tip: You can also dress the greens before plating the salad. Simply toss the greens in a large bowl with your desired amount of dressing until evenly coated. Plate the greens with the tomatoes, radishes and avocado, then sprinkle with cranberries and top with sliced steak.

recipes.title: Chili-Rubbed Steak with Black Bean Salad
recipes.description: Busy weeknights don't stop my husband from firing up the grill. This meal-in-one comes together fast. Try it with chimichurri and cotija cheese.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.text: Rub steak with chili powder and salt. Grill, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from heat 6-8 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 135°; medium, 140°).
Heat rice according to package directions. Transfer rice to a small bowl; stir in beans and salsa. Slice steak thinly across the grain; serve with bean salad. If desired, sprinkle with cilantro.

recipes.title: Chicken Salad with Grapes
recipes.description: Bored with the usual turkey sandwich? This easy chicken salad with grapes recipe is anything but boring! Shredded rotisserie chicken is dressed in a creamy dressing and tossed with juicy grapes, crunchy celery and chopped pecans.

ingredients.item: Lettuce leaves or whole wheat bread slices, optional

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Add the chicken, grapes, pecans, celery and, if desired, onion. Mix lightly to coat. If desired, serve with lettuce leaves or whole wheat bread.

recipes.title: Greek Orzo Salad
recipes.description: This tart, refreshing salad is a big hit in my home. All the tasty toppings

ingredients.item: 1 medium cucumber, peeled, seeded and chopped
12 pitted ripe or Greek olives, halved

instructions.text: Cook the orzo according to package directions. Drain the orzo, and transfer to a large bowl. Toss with 2 teaspoons oil. Editor's Tip: Make sure to use a big pinch of salt in your pasta water! This will help infuse the orzo with some flavor from the start.

In a separate smaller bowl, whisk together the onion, parsley, vinegar, oregano, salt, sugar, pepper and remaining 4 teaspoons oil. Pour the onion mixture over the orzo, and toss to evenly coat. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Just before serving, gently stir in the tomatoes, cucumber, olives and cheese.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Salad
recipes.description: We love how easy this spaghetti salad recipe is to prepare in advance. After it sets up in the fridge, it's a hearty, flavorful side dish or entree that's perfect for a crowd.

ingredients.item: 1 large cucumber, halved, seeded and diced

instructions.text: Cook the spaghetti according to the package directions, then drain and rinse it in cold water. Place the spaghetti in a large bowl, then add the tomatoes, zucchini, cucumber and peppers.
Combine the Italian dressing, Parmesan cheese, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, paprika, celery seed and garlic powder; pour over the salad and toss to coat.
Cover the salad and refrigerate it for at least two hours. Before serving, sprinkle it with chopped parsley, if desired.

recipes.title: Tuna Nicoise Salad
recipes.description: Tuna Nicoise salad is a perfect lunch for a weekend or even to make ahead for the work week. Our recipe is traditional with tuna, tomatoes and beans, but is easily adaptable to suit your tastes.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup oil and vinegar salad dressing
3 pouches (2-1/2 ounces each) light tuna in water

instructions.text: Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook, uncovered, until tender, 8 to 10 minutes, adding the green beans during the last three minutes of cooking. Drain the pot and immediately drop the potatoes and beans into ice water. Drain and pat dry. Editor's Tip: You can salt the cooking water for extra flavor, but don't add the salt until the water is boiling. Salted water takes longer to bring to a boil.
In a small bowl, combine the salad dressing, lemon zest and pepper.

Divide the romaine among four plates. Arrange the potatoes, green beans, eggs, tuna and tomatoes over the romaine. Serve with the dressing mixture on the side or poured over, if you'll be eating immediately. Editor's Tip: Assembling the salad ingredients on separate plates allows for an attractive presentation and ensures an even distribution of the larger ingredients. Unlike many other types of salad, Nicoise is rarely tossed together.

recipes.title: Couscous Salad
recipes.description: This couscous salad recipe gets five stars from our reviewers! Create a versatile, summery salad that can be served as a potluck dish or a light lunch. Or, feel free to add chickpeas, grilled meat or seafood to make it filling enough to enjoy for dinner.

ingredients.item: 3 medium ears sweet corn, husks removed
1 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth

instructions.text: Place the corn in a Dutch oven, and cover the corn with water. Bring the water to a boil. Cover and cook for six to nine minutes or until the corn is tender. Editor's Tip: If you're using frozen corn, you can go ahead and skip this step. Thaw it in the refrigerator overnight, and either add it to the salad as-is or heat it in a skillet to give it some depth.

While the corn is cooking, in a small saucepan, bring the broth to a boil. Stir in the couscous, then remove the pan from the heat. Cover and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes or until the broth is absorbed. Fluff the couscous with a fork and set it aside to cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, cheese, onion and parsley.

Drain the corn and immediately place it in ice water. Drain off the water and pat the corn dry. Cut the kernels from the cobs. Editor's Tip: Check out the video below for our Test Kitchen's mess-free corn-cutting method. We balance the ear on the center of a fluted tube pan, allowing the tall-sided bowl to catch the kernels as they're cut.
Add the corn to the cucumber mixture. Stir in the couscous.
In a small bowl, whisk the oil, lemon juice, oregano, cumin, salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the couscous mixture and toss to coat. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate until chilled.

recipes.title: Chopped Chicken Caesar Salad Sandwiches
recipes.description: Imagine: A creamy garlicky dressing, crunchy romaine lettuce and hearty chicken all encased in a chewy bun that's like a super-sized crouton. These chopped chicken Caesar salad sandwiches are simple, delightful and perfect for salad lovers.

ingredients.item: 1 can (12-1/2 ounces) chunk white chicken, drained or 1 cup finely chopped cooked chicken

instructions.text: In a large bowl, add the chopped cooked chicken, romaine lettuce, tomatoes, dressing and cheese. Stir until well combined.
Divide the mixture among the bottom halves of the rolls. Sprinkle with freshly cracked pepper, if desired.
